meanings.definition: Holding the attention or interest of someone
meanings.sent1: The movie was so riveting that I couldn't look away.
meanings.sent2: The book had a riveting plot that kept me reading late into the night.
meanings.sent3: The magician's tricks were so riveting that the audience gasped in amazement.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was as riveting as a magnet pulling in iron filings.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster ride was a riveting experience that I will never forget.

meanings.sent1: The blacksmith was riveting the metal pieces together to create a strong bond.
meanings.sent2: She carefully riveted the leather straps to ensure they wouldn't come loose.
meanings.sent3: The tailor riveted the buttons onto the coat with precision and skill.
meanings.sent4: His words riveted her attention like a lock securing a treasure chest.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter riveted the joints of the table, making it sturdy and reliable.

meanings.definition: A metal pin for passing through holes in two or more plates to hold them together
meanings.sent1: The construction worker used a riveting to connect the steel beams.
meanings.sent2: She found a rusty riveting in the old toolbox and used it to fix the broken gate.
meanings.sent3: The artist used a decorative riveting to embellish the metal sculpture.
meanings.sent4: The friendship between them was like a strong riveting, keeping them close despite any challenges.
meanings.sent5: The ancient armor was adorned with intricate rivetings, showcasing the craftsmanship of the past.
